main event: On 14 August 1957, two brilliant lights were observed in the sky over Severna Park, Maryland.
interesting points: The objects appeared to change direction several times before disappearing., The lights were seen at about 300-400 feet in the sky., Witnesses noted that the lights looked like baseballs and were stationary for a portion of the observation., No sound or exhaust trail was associated with the observed lights., The lights were described as self-luminous and larger than stars.
sighted object: two brilliant lights in the sky
witness description: A minister and two companions were taking an evening stroll when they observed the lights.
